---
title: "About Me"
---

I am a PhD Student at the University of Texas at Dallas in Public Policy and Political Economy. I also serve as an Assistant Professor of Practice of Political Science at Texas Tech University at Waco. I received a Bachelor's degree in Journalism and Masters degrees in Social Work and Public Affairs. I have a background in criminal justice social work, research, and policy advocacy. My current research interests are studying criminal justice and immigration systems from a human rights perspective.

Works in Progress:

-   Expanding Path Dependence Theory to Criminal Justice Outcomes in the South.

-   Cash Bail Reform: Testing Competing Political Expectations.

-   Predictors of Human Rights Abuses in Immigrant Detention.
